title: Lil' Slugger Trundle splash art teaser...

replies.body: I was wondering when someone would post this. The new Trist/Nid/Trundle splashes are coming along nicely. Can't wait to show them to you guys! Trundle will likely be the first batch released.
Will Karma be getting updated splash arts at some point, or will she just be keeping the Chinese splash arts?
At some point all previous VUs will be getting new splash art, yes.

> [{quoted}](name=Reav3,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=heAwQATF,comment-id=000200010000,timestamp=2016-03-28T15:13:03.193+0000)
>
> At some point all previous VUs will be getting new splash art, yes.

Were all the champions that are having splash arts replaced with Chinese art VU'd at some point in the past? Or are some of these Chinese arts going to stick around forever cause some champs didn't get the VU treatment and thus maybe don't warrant a complete overhaul in the eyes of Riot? I'm wondering because I'm not much of a fan of the Ahri or Crimson Akali changes. :(

Once we get through all the previous VU'd champs we would certainly open the conversation about going through and updating other champions splash art that didn't receive VU's.

The Chinese Splash art had nothing to do with champions that were VU'd in the past.

> [{quoted}](name=Reav3,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=heAwQATF,comment-id=00020001000000010001,timestamp=2016-03-28T17:25:11.540+0000)

> The Chinese Splash art had nothing to do with champions that were VU'd in the past.

Is Sona on the Champion VU list for splash art updates?

For the record, these are all the champions that are on the list for skin splash reworks right now. In no particular order.

Nidalee, Trundle, Tristana, Sion, Miss Fortune, Alistar, Kassadin, Gangplank, Twitch, Fiora, Karthas, Maokai, Karma, Garen, Morgana, Sivir, Sona, Annie, Renekton, Nasus & Heimerdinger

> [{quoted}](name=Reav3,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=heAwQATF,comment-id=0002000100000001000100000000,timestamp=2016-03-28T18:44:50.241+0000)

I'm curious, the fact that a champion is on the list for a skin splash rework doesn't necessarily mean that all of their splashes will be updated, correct? Like for each of the champions you listed, skins that came out in the last year or two wouldn't need to be updated because they are already high quality right? (DJ Sona, Arcade MF, those Bilgewater skins from last year, etc.)
That is correct. Only the low quality splash art would be updated.

Will you guys be putting them out as whole bundles (The entirety of the updated splashes you did for one champion all at once) or as groups when they're complete (Some updated splashes from various champions who're finished now and ready to go)? Or maybe a bit of both?

For Trist/Trundle/Nidalee they will come out with all the champions splash art at once. Others might come out more piecemeal, as there are some almost finished splash art we have internally before we started on the Trist/Trundle/Nid ones.

For example, we have a half way finished Night Raven Fiora Splash which we were going to finish we got around to updating Fiora's old splash art. Given the current situation we might bump that one up in priority and release it alone.
Can you say whether or not Festival Kassadin in particular is being updated? The skin is neat, the splash as you know is.... old. :p
When we get around to Kassadin, yes that one will get updated. Hopefully we can make it 100% more festive! :)
please pleeeeease don't alter nidalee's skin tone so much - her more recent skins are significantly less brown than her classic and it's really bothersome :(
Please, and i beg you PLEASE don't change the splash for Blackthorn Morgana. It's one of my fav splashes in the game. It's also the first skin I've gotten. D:

Wait, does this include Karthus?

I'm really curious why Master Yi got an update to his classic splash art about 6 months before his VU.
He had his old one at first, of course, that has since been long forgotten (to be fair, it has a lot of years under its belt).
Then he got a new, epic looking splash art (the one we have to this day). And then he got a visual update.

The thing that's been bugging me for nearly three years now is that when Yi was updated, he got a little more armor, specifically on the upper part of his body, and he trimmed his long beard (which isn't even visible in-game anymore) - yet the same splash was and has been used for years!
The long beard and less dressed for combat splash art was apparently good enough post-update.

Seems like I'm the only one who looked at the updated Yi's in-game appearance and thought: "I want a new splash art for this."
Does Sivir count? Also will her base be uptated to a more anatomically sensical position?
For champions with "Traditional" skins, like Trundle; will those be updated too?
Yes, Traditional Trundles splash art is getting updated as well

The traditional skins are getting updated as well? ... I thought that the point of having a Traditional Skin was to remember the old days of the champ.

The purpose is to have a skin that resembles what the old champion used to look like, pre-rework. Not to have intentionally low quality art. The in-game skin looks like a updated version of old trundle and the new splash should as well.
